attributes.action: Reduce tuition fees for those studying at specialist universities
attributes.additional_details: Students at specialist universities can't access fundamental facilities such as wood workshops, 3D printers or kilns. The amount and level of work being produced isn't up to standard as the facilities cannot be accessed and students don't have enough space (e.g. producing in studio flats). Students doing sandwich years are paying £1850 for even more reduced teaching and cannot find internships. Contact hours are reduced, there's limited access to libraries and pre-recording prevents questions.
attributes.background:
Reduce and subsidise the following tuition fees for those studying at specialist institutions:

Sandwich fee - £1850 
Home fee - £9250
International fee - £22,920

rejection.details:
Decisions about setting and refunding tuition fees are, provided these are within the legal limits for undergraduate students, a matter for individual universities.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign: 

Require universities to partially refund tuition fees for 20/21 due to Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324762

Require universities to fully refund tuition fees for the Autumn term: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555583

Lower university tuition fees for students until online teaching ends: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552911

Government subsidise this year's university tuition fees: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552814

Refund ALL University student tuition fees due to lack of quality in education: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555516

Reduce student loan debts by the cost of all tuition fees paid during Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560953
